item.title: [PI] Better Skills; Read also
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“Python_, post:19, topic:392564”][quote author=Primadude link=topic=489736.msg3584643#msg3584643 date=1304068154]

You’re not explaining anything in this tutorial; all you’re doing is telling the users to copy and paste shit.

kk, let’s spoonfeed. Want me to feed you, and wipe your ass as well? Pathetic.

Do you people even read the threads before you comment on them? Read the FIRST damn paragraph. Idiots.

Shut the fuck up. The whole point of writing a tutorial is to TEACH SOMETHING, not to just hand out code for all the deficient little 12 year olds to copy & paste (That’s what the snippets sticky is for…).
[/quote]

Yep, and I did teach something; “How to add better skills”. Not how to add the skills, and make them work with your server/fix your errors. Kthanx.[/quote]

People can’t come away from this thread thinking that they’ve learned something; this is just a copy and paste “tutorial”, a waste of space in this section.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Better Skills; Read also
item.dc:creator: @Diligo_Deum Diligo Deum
item.description:
@Diligo_Deum wrote:

[quote=“Primadude, post:12, topic:392564”][quote author=Diligo Deum link=topic=489736.msg3582769#msg3582769 date=1303928050]

public static void resetPlayerSkillVariables(Client c) { for(int i = 0; i < 20; i++) if(c.playerSkilling[i]) for(int l = 0; l < 15; l++) c.playerSkillProp[i][l] = -1; }

Your conventions are horrible.
[/quote]Those aren’t the conventions I use, but they are there to shorten the code

It’s not shortening the code properly; it’s just making the code look like shit and making it not follow proper conventions.[/quote]true but it’s shorter, if you want to follow proper conventions then he would just bring the 2nd if statement down, then for loop down again, then finally the action using Client c down again

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Better Skills; Read also
item.dc:creator: @Diligo_Deum Diligo Deum
item.description:
@Diligo_Deum wrote:

Looks okay but try shortening code like this

public static void resetPlayerSkillVariables(Client c) { for(int i = 0; i < 20; i++) { if(c.playerSkilling[i]) { for(int l = 0; l < 15; l++) { c.playerSkillProp[i][l] = -1; } } } }
to

public static void resetPlayerSkillVariables(Client c) { for(int i = 0; i < 20; i++) if(c.playerSkilling[i]) for(int l = 0; l < 15; l++) c.playerSkillProp[i][l] = -1; }

also I like your improvement, changing a skill instance / player to a skill instance per world.

Read full topic
